title: Extraction - Optimization - AI Translation - Reinsertion
platform_tooltip: This platform is under development and will be enabled soon
manual_step_1_content:
ğŸ¯ What It Does

Copies all text from your game (dialogues, menus, items) into a file you can read.

ğŸ“ How to Use

  1. 1. Choose Console: Click where it says platform (example: Super Nintendo, PlayStation 1, Game Boy Advance, PC Games)
  2. 2. Choose Game: Click "Select ROM" and pick your game file
  3. 3. Press Button: Click "Extract Texts"
  4. 4. Wait to Finish: The green bar will fill up to 100%

âœ… What Will Happen

  • A text file will be created named: game_name_extracted.txt
  • Takes 30 seconds to 2 minutes
  • You can see progress in the green bar

âš ï¸ Tips

  • If game is in Japanese, you'll see strange symbols (this is normal!)
  • Some games may have little text - don't worry, continue to next step
manual_step_2_content:
ğŸ¯ What It Does

Cleans the text file by removing repeated things and nonsense text. This makes the file much smaller!

ğŸ“ How to Use

  1. 1. Press Button: Click "Optimize Data" (still in Extraction tab)
  2. 2. Wait to Clean: Program will clean automatically
  3. 3. See Result: At the bottom it will show how much it reduced

âœ… What Will Happen

  • New file created: game_name_optimized.txt
  • Real example: From 755,000 lines to 150,000 lines (saves 80%!)
  • Takes only 5 to 15 seconds

ğŸ’¡ Why Do This?

  • Save Money: Less text = you pay less for translation
  • Faster: Translation becomes 5 times faster
  • Better Quality: Removes nonsense text that messes up translation

ğŸ§¹ What Gets Removed

  • Repeated text (if "Hello" appears 100 times, keeps only 1)
  • Random nonsense letters (like "XYZABC", "QQWWRR")
  • Weird symbols and game codes
manual_step_3_content:
ğŸ¯ What It Does

Translates game text using Artificial Intelligence (robot translator).

ğŸ“ HOW TO USE (Step-by-Step Visual Guide)

ğŸ”¹ STEP 1: Go to Translation Tab

At the top of the window, click the "ğŸ§  2. Translation" tab

ğŸ”¹ STEP 2: Choose File to Translate

â€¢ Click the "Select File" button
â€¢ Choose the *_optimized.txt file you created in Step 2

ğŸ”¹ STEP 2.5: Source Language (Already Configured!)

Right below you'll see a field called "Source Language (ROM)" showing:

AUTO-DETECT â† âœ“ Already set!

âœ… LEAVE IT ON AUTO-DETECT! No need to change!

What is AUTO-DETECT?

  • ğŸ” The program figures out by itself if the game is in English, Japanese, Spanish, etc.
  • âœ… You don't need to know what language the original game is in
  • âœ… Works with any game - Japanese, English, Korean, Chinese, etc.
  • âš¡ It's automatic - the program detects and translates!

ğŸ’¡ Only change if you're absolutely certain of the original language. But leaving it on AUTO-DETECT is always the best option!

ğŸ”¹ STEP 3: Configure Translation Mode

You will see a section called "Translation Mode" with a menu showing:

ğŸ”„ Auto (Gemini â†’ Ollama) â† âœ“ Already selected!

âœ… LEAVE IT LIKE THIS! This is the best option!

What "Auto (Gemini â†’ Ollama)" means:

  • âœ… Starts using Gemini (fast, uses Google internet)
  • âœ… When free runs out, automatically switches to Ollama (on your PC, unlimited)
  • âœ… YOU DON'T NEED TO DO ANYTHING! It's automatic!

ğŸ”¹ STEP 4: Google Key (Optional - Can skip!)

Further down you'll see "API Configuration" with a field for "API Key:"

Can leave it blank! The program will work without it using Ollama (free, unlimited).

If you want to use Gemini (faster), see how to get free key at the end of this page.

ğŸ”¹ STEP 5: Start Translation

â€¢ Press the big button "ğŸ¤– Translate with AI"
â€¢ Watch the progress bar fill up
â€¢ May take 15 minutes to 1 hour

â±ï¸ How Long Does It Take?

  • Small games: 5-15 minutes
  • Medium games: 20-40 minutes
  • Large games: 1 hour or more

ğŸ’¡ Can close program and continue later! Progress is saved.

âœ… WILL MY PC WORK?

âœ“ YES! WORKS ON ANY PC!

ğŸŒ Gemini Mode (internet):

  • âœ… Any PC with internet works!
  • âœ… No graphics card needed
  • âœ… No high RAM needed
  • âœ… Even old laptops work!

ğŸ’» Ollama Mode (on your PC):

  • âœ… Any PC works - only speed changes!
  • Basic PC (8GB RAM): Slower, but works
  • Good PC (16GB RAM): Fast
  • Powerful PC (32GB RAM): Very fast

ğŸ’° How Much Does It Cost?

  • Gemini Free: 20 translations per day = $0.00
  • Ollama: Unlimited = $0.00 (only uses PC electricity)
  • Gemini Paid (if you want): $0.50-$2.00 per full game

ğŸ”‘ EXTRA: How to Get Google Gemini Key (Free)

This is optional! Program works without it.

  1. Visit: https://aistudio.google.com/apikey
  2. Login with your Google account
  3. Click "Create API Key"
  4. Copy the key
  5. Paste in "API Key:" field in program

âœ… Done! You get 20 fast free translations per day!

ğŸ’» EXTRA: What is Ollama and How to Install

Ollama is a FREE program that translates on your PC without internet.

  1. Download at: https://ollama.com
  2. Install like any program
  3. Done! Program will use it automatically

Advantage: Unlimited, no cost, no daily limit!
manual_step_4_content:
ğŸ¯ What It Does

Puts translated text back inside the game. This is the final step!

ğŸ“ HOW TO USE (Step-by-Step Visual Guide)

ğŸ”¹ STEP 1: Go to Reinsertion Tab

At the top of the window, click the "ğŸ“¥ 3. Reinsertion" tab

ğŸ”¹ STEP 2: Choose Original Game

â€¢ Click "ğŸ“‚ Original ROM" then "Select ROM"
â€¢ Choose the same game file you used at the beginning (.smc, .bin, .nds, etc.)

ğŸ”¹ STEP 3: Choose Translated Text

â€¢ Click "ğŸ“„ Translated File" then "Select File"
â€¢ Choose the *_translated.txt file created in Step 3

ğŸ”¹ STEP 4: Name Your Translated Game

â€¢ In the "ğŸ’¾ Translated ROM (Output)" field
â€¢ Type a name, example: MyGame_EN.smc

ğŸ”¹ STEP 5: Create Translated Game

â€¢ Press the "Reinsert Translation" button
â€¢ Wait 10 to 60 seconds
â€¢ Done! Your translated game is created!

âœ… What Happened?

  • âœ… New game created with the name you chose
  • âœ… Your original game stays intact (not modified)
  • âœ… Now just test it in the emulator!

ğŸ® How to Test Translated Game

ğŸ”¹ What is An Emulator?

It's a program that lets you play old console games on your computer.

ğŸ”¹ Recommended Emulators (Download Free)

  • Super Nintendo (SNES): SNES9x or ZSNES
  • PlayStation 1: ePSXe or DuckStation
  • Game Boy Advance: VisualBoy Advance
  • Nintendo DS: DeSmuME or melonDS

ğŸ”¹ How to Test (Simple!)

  1. Open the emulator for the correct console
  2. Click File â†’ Open
  3. Choose your translated game
  4. Play a bit and see if text is in your language!

ğŸ’¡ Important Tips

  • âœ… Always test translated game before sharing
  • âœ… Use emulator Save States to save anytime
  • âœ… Keep the *_translated.txt file - you may need it later
  • âœ… If you get an error, you can redo just Step 4 (it's fast!)
  • âœ… Share your work with other players! ğŸ®

ğŸ‰ Congratulations! You Did It!

ğŸŠ YOUR GAME IS READY!

âœ… Translation complete!
âœ… Game created successfully!
âœ… Everything working perfectly!

Now just play and have fun! ğŸ®âœ¨

â“ Frequently Asked Questions (If You Have Any Doubts)

ğŸ”½ Click here if you encounter any problems (rare, but can happen)

ğŸ”¸ Some Text Appears Cut Off

Why it happens: Translations are naturally longer than Japanese/English.

Solution: This is common in translations! You can:

  • âœ… Play normally - you can understand even when cut off
  • ğŸ”§ If you know how to edit text: shorten sentences in *_translated.txt and redo reinsertion

ğŸ”¸ Weird Symbols Instead of Accents

Why it happens: The original game wasn't programmed for special letters (Ã£, Ã±, Ã©, etc.)

Solution: You can:

  • âœ… Play normally - "cafe" is easy to understand!
  • ğŸ”§ If you know how to edit text: replace accents with normal letters in *_translated.txt

ğŸ”¸ Game Won't Open in Emulator

What to do:

  1. Try using a different emulator (each works better with certain games)
  2. Check if you chose the right emulator for the console
  3. If it doesn't work, download the original game again and redo only Step 4

ğŸ”§ For Advanced Users - Manual Editing

How to edit the translation file:

  1. Right-click *_translated.txt
  2. Choose "Open with... â†’ Notepad"
  3. Edit whatever you want (shorten sentences, replace accents, fix errors)
  4. Save (Ctrl+S)
  5. Go back to the program and redo only Step 4 (Reinsertion)
help_step3_objective_text: Translates game text using AI robot translator.
help_step3_instructions_text:
1. Choose *_optimized.txt file
2. Leave on AUTO (or choose Gemini/Ollama)
3. If you have it, paste Google key
4. Press 'Translate with AI'
help_step3_expect_text:
Creates file: *_translated.txt
Takes: 15-45 minutes for large games
Can close and continue later
help_step3_automode_text:
Uses Gemini (fast) first
When free runs out, switches to Ollama
Best option: fast + unlimited
help_step3_style_text:
ğŸ•¹ï¸ Arcade (NES/Master): VERY short text, simple vocabulary, no articles - ideal for 8-bit games with limited space

ğŸ® Classic (SNES/Mega) [REC]: Official 90s localization style - natural Portuguese, short sentences, no modern slang. RECOMMENDED for most ROMs

ğŸ’¿ CD-ROM (PS1/N64/Saturn): More text space, natural elaborate dialogues - ideal for RPGs and adventures from 32-bit era

ğŸ“± Current (2010+): Contemporary Portuguese, modern vocabulary, keeps original tone - for indies and remasters

ğŸ“– Literal (Faithful): Closest to English, preserves sentence structure - for maximum fidelity
help_step3_genre_text:
Select the game genre for context-appropriate translation:

âš”ï¸ RPG: Epic immersive language
ğŸ—¡ï¸ Action: Dynamic exciting text
ğŸ¯ Strategy: Clear tactical terms
ğŸ¥Š Fighting: Short impactful phrases
ğŸ‘» Horror: Tense dark atmosphere
ğŸ”« Shooter: Military terminology
ğŸ„ Platform: Fun light tone
ğŸ§© Puzzle: Logical precise language
ğŸï¸ Sports: Energetic terminology
ğŸï¸ Sandbox: Exploration freedom
ğŸ—ºï¸ Metroidvania: Exploration hints
ğŸ§’ Children: Simple positive language
help_step3_realtime_text:
ğŸ“º Located on the RIGHT side of the screen

ğŸŸ¡ Original: Shows the English text being translated
ğŸŸ¢ Translation: Shows the Portuguese translation
âš¡ Translator: Indicates which AI is translating (Llama 3.1/Gemini)

ğŸ’¡ Panel updates with each translated text
ğŸ’¡ Allows visual progress tracking
ğŸ’¡ If you don't want to watch, leave it running in background
help_step3_cache_text:
ğŸ’¾ WHAT IT IS: System saves all translations to local cache

âš¡ ADVANTAGE: If you translate the same game again, it's instant (uses saved translations)

â˜‘ï¸ CHECKBOX 'Use cache':
â€¢ Checked = uses saved translations (fast)
â€¢ Unchecked = ignores cache but does NOT delete

ğŸ—‘ï¸ BUTTON 'Clear Cache':
â€¢ DELETES cache files from disk
â€¢ Frees up space
â€¢ Use when you want to retranslate with new style/genre

ğŸ“ LOCATION: cache_traducoes.json in framework folder

âœ… Everything working perfectly!

Now just play and have fun! ğŸ®âœ¨

manual_gfx_body:
ğŸ¨ Graphics Editor Tutorial

Step 1: Visualize

Navigate using offsets. Change Format (bpp) to fix garbled graphics.

Step 2: Export

Click ğŸ’¾ Export PNG to save to your PC.

Step 3: Edit

Edit in any image editor. DO NOT CHANGE PALETTE COLORS!

Step 4: Import

Click ğŸ“¥ Import PNG to insert back into ROM.

Step 5: Save

Changes are written automatically to the ROM file.
manual_pc_games_body:
ğŸ¯ 2026 UPDATE: PC Auto Reinsertion!

âœ… NEW!

Tabs 1, 2 AND 3 work for PC (.exe)!

  • âœ… Tab 1 Extract â†’ WORKS!
  • âœ… Tab 2 Translate â†’ WORKS! 15 languages
  • âœ… Tab 3 Reinsert â†’ WORKS for .exe! NEW!
  • âŒ Tab 4 Graphics Lab â†’ ROMs only

â“ Console vs PC

ConsolePC (.exe)
âœ… Tab 3 autoâœ… Tab 3 auto NEW!
âœ… Tab 4 worksâŒ Tab 4 no

ğŸ“ STEPS

âœ… STEP 1: Extract

  1. Tab 1
  2. Select: PC Games
  3. Choose .exe

âœ… STEP 2: Translate

  1. Tab 2
  2. Select *_optimized.txt
  3. 15 languages: PT, EN, ES, FR, DE, IT, JA, KO, ZH, RU, AR, HI, TR, PL, NL

âœ… STEP 3: Reinsert

  1. Tab 3
  2. Select original .exe

  4. Click Reinsert
  5. â³ 2-3 min
  6. âœ… Done!

âš ï¸ Use Originals!
